bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, September 6, 1940

div1.p: Hench seeks permission to incorporate Rodriguez Leon's version of Lazear's death into his manuscript.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, September 6, 1940
div1.opener:
September 6, 1940
Senora Estella Agramonte Rodriguez-Leon
Vedado
Havana, Cuba
My dear Senora Rodriguez-Leon:
div1.p:
Perhaps by now you have received my memorandum and
photographs. I have just received word from General Truby that both
he and General Kean are willing for me to tell their version of the
true manner in which Dr. Lazear became ill. General Truby was in
1900 Lieutenant in charge of the Columbia Barracks Hospital and helped
to take care of Dr. Lazear during his illness. In view of their
willingness for me to quote them on the occasion of the Lazear Memorial
dedication, I am hoping that I can incorporate your version also as
this would add much to the authenticity of the story. I sincerely
hope that you are willing for me to do this, and that you will, therefore,
correct and amplify my understanding of your version as given in my
memorandum. It seems a most appropriate time and place to give Dr. Lazear
this belated recognition and I am most appreciative of your kind considera-
tion in this matter.

Mrs. Hench joins me in sending you and your husband our
very kindest regards and best wishes.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
